newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Inflation blip seen in October - Venezuela's Matos.
newsitem.headline: Inflation blip seen in October - Venezuela's Matos.

text.p: Venezuelan inflation is expected to rise briefly in October on one-off electricity rate hikes, Finance Minister Luis Raul Matos Azocar said, but the country's underlying inflationary trend remains down.
"Underlying inflation is broken," Matos told reporters.
"We'll only see this October blip due to the decision (to raise electricity rates). And as no more hikes are seen for the rest of the year, we'll soon be back on track for our targets."
However, Matos said seasonal factors, such as the beginning of the school year, might also help push up October inflation from September's 3.6 percent rate.

The government raised residential electricity rates by an average of 50 percent on October 4. The IMF inflation target for the end of the year is a monthly rate of 1.5 percent, although Planning Minister Teodoro Petkoff recently said a two to three percent monthly rate in December was more likely.
